stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements correctly explains the role of fossil fuels in the production of energy?
choicesHtml: The combustion of fossil fuels heats water to produce steam, which then turns a turbine.
The steam released from the combustion of fossil fuels turns a generator, which then powers a turbine.
The heat released from burning fossil fuels rises and turns a turbine, which then releases carbon dioxide.
Steam produced from a turbine ignites the fossil fuels, which then powers the generator.
